ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Voyager 1 Saturn Cosmic Ray Subsystem (CRS) Electron Telescope D1 Counting Rates, Version 1.0, 192 s Summary Data
ResourceHeader.Description:
* Data Set Overview * =================
This Data Set describes the Counting Rate Data from Detectors D1 and D2 in the Cosmic Ray Subsystem (CRS) Electron Telescope (TET) on Voyager 1 during the Saturn Encounter. The D1 Detector nominally responds to Electrons with Kinetic Energies above approximately 1 MeV, and the D2 Detector, above approximately 2.5 MeV (see Detector Description for Details).
Note that the Instrument is saturated near the Maximum of Counting Rate of approximately 50,000 counts per second. When Data are near Saturation, the Counting Rates should be corrected for Deadtime according to the Formula in the DATA_SET_OR_INST_PARM_DESC: (corrected rate)=(uncorrected rate/(1+deadtime*(uncorrected rate)).
+------------------------------------------------------+ | Parameter Characteristics | Value | -------------------------------------------------------- | Sampling Parameter Resolution | 192.0 | | Minimum Sampling Parameter | N/A | | Maximum Sampling Parameter | N/A | | Sampling Parameter Interval | 192.0 | | Minimum available Sampling Int | 192.0 | | Sampling Parameter Unit | SECOND | | Data Set Parameter Name | D1/D2 RATE | | Noise Level | 0.000 COUNTS/SECOND | | Data Set Parameter Unit | COUNTS/SECOND | +------------------------------------------------------+
